title: On the Go appoints first global MD
text:
On the Go appoints first global MD 6 August 2015 Save 
On the Go Tours has appointed Carl Cross to the newly created role of managing director for its global operations. 
The former general manager retail, product and marketing of Flight Centre will now be responsible for all aspects on On the Go’s business. 
To meet the requirements of his new job, Cross will split his time between the operator’s offices in London and Australia, as well as spend time in Canada, South Africa and New Zealand. 
Cross said: “I always wanted to work in a tour operator as my career to date has always been at the retail end. 
“We need to continue to develop our product in line with the broadening demographics of our customers. 
“I have worked with On The Go Tours in various capacities throughout my Flight Centre career and have always admired their entrepreneurial culture and relentless focus on the customer experience. 
“In that time I have watched them grow from a small London-based Middle East tour operator to a larger global enterprise with teams around the world selling life changing experiences to tens of thousands of customers to over 50 countries and growing.” 
Scott Braidwood, co-founder and owner of On The Go Tours, said: “Carl brings a wealth of knowledge and enthusiasm to our team and will be a great asset to On The Go Tours. 
“After many years with Flight Centre both in Australia and the UK he has a deep understanding of our business and we are all looking forward to reaching new heights under his leadership.” 
The appointment comes as general manager Pru Goudie stands down from her role at the business. 
She said: “After 7-years it felt like a good time to move on and I am looking forward to a well deserved break over the remainder of the summer.”
